recipes.name: Tteokbokki
recipes.description: A widely enjoyed Korean street food featuring chewy, plush rice cakes simmered in a sweet and savoury sauce. Often served with additions like fish cakes and deep-fried foods.
recipes.sourceSubtext: A Korean Mom's Kitchen Wisdom and 100 Family Recipes
ingredients: 1 1/2 tsp sesame seeds, toasted, plus extra for sprinkling
preparation: If using frozen rice cakes or fish cakes, thaw them completely first.
Submerge the fish cake sheets in hot water and let soak for 1 minute, then drain. Repeat the soaking and draining process once more.
Halve the fish cake sheets lengthwise, then slice them crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick pieces.
Slice the yellow onion 1/8-inch thick.
Trim the daepa (jumbo green onion), halve it lengthwise, and cut it into 2 1/2-inch lengths.
instructions: Heat the neutral oil in a 14-inch flat-bottomed wok or 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering.
Add the yellow onion and daepa and cook, tossing constantly, until fragrant and evenly coated in the oil, about 1 minute.
Add the prepared fish cakes and tteok (rice cakes) and toss to combine.
Stir in the water, sugar, gochujang, gochugaru, Dasida powder, and soy sauce until thoroughly combined.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens and coats the tteok, about 10 to 12 minutes.
Stir in the garlic. Turn off the heat and stir in the toasted sesame oil and toasted sesame seeds.
Transfer the tteokbokki to a serving platter, sprinkle with extra sesame seeds, and serve immediately.
recipes.notes: Substitute an equal weight of regular green onions for the daepa.

recipes.name: Cucumber Kimchi
recipes.description: Oi Kimchi is a popular kimchi to enjoy in the summer because it's easy to prepare and offers a refreshing taste. This is a ready-to-eat kimchi that is vibrantly crisp and savory with a hint of spiciness.
recipes.sourceSubtext: A Korean Mom's Kitchen Wisdom and 100 Family Recipes
preparation: Trim the cucumbers, halve them lengthwise (seeding if desired), and slice crosswise into 1-inch thick pieces.
Cut the yellow onion into 1 1/2-inch pieces and separate the layers.
Cut the garlic chives into 1 1/2-inch lengths.
Stem the Fresno chile, halve it lengthwise, and slice it thin crosswise.
In a large bowl, toss the cucumbers with 1 tbsp of the sugar and all of the salt. Let sit for 20 minutes, tossing the cucumbers halfway through.
Drain the cucumbers in a colander, shaking to release any additional liquid. Rinse and dry the now-empty bowl.
instructions: Using your gloved hands, toss the drained cucumbers with the onion, chives, Fresno chile, maesil cheong, fish sauce, garlic, gochugaru, ginger, and the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons of sugar in the large bowl until evenly combined.
Transfer the mixture to a 3-quart storage container, cover, and place in a cool, dry, dark location away from direct sunlight for 2 hours to begin fermentation.
Serve immediately for a fresh taste or refrigerate. The flavor will continue to develop over time. It can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 1 1/2 months.
recipes.notes: Look for smaller pickling cucumbers like Kirby cucumbers (2 to 3 ounces each) as they contain fewer seeds. Korean cucumbers also work well, but Persian cucumbers are not recommended for this recipe.

recipes.name: Korean Fried Chicken
recipes.description: Crispy and juicy Korean-style fried chicken, seasoned with a flavorful blend of spices and fried to perfection for an extra crunchy crust.
recipes.sourceSubtext: A Korean Mom's Kitchen Wisdom and 100 Family Recipes
preparation: Cut chicken wings at the joints, discarding the wingtips. Separate into drumettes and wingettes.
In a large bowl, submerge the chicken pieces in milk. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Drain the milk and thoroughly rinse the chicken under cold water until it runs clear. Pat the chicken completely dry with paper towels.
Using the tip of a sharp knife, pierce each chicken piece 4 to 5 times on each side around the bone.
In a clean bowl, toss the chicken with 1 tsp black pepper and the MSG seasoning salt. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Prepare a wire rack set inside a rimmed baking sheet.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together 1 cup of the Korean frying mix, 1/2 tbsp of the curry powder, and all of the Dasida, garlic powder, and onion powder to create the dry dredge.
In a separate large bowl, whisk the remaining 2 1/2 cups frying mix and the remaining 1/2 tbsp curry powder. Gradually whisk in the cold water to form a batter. Do not overmix; small lumps are okay.
In a deep fryer or large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat 2-3 quarts of vegetable oil to 330°F (165°C).
Working one piece at a time, toss a piece of chicken in the dry dredge to coat, then dip it into the wet batter, allowing any excess to drip off.
Carefully place the battered chicken into the hot oil. Repeat with a few more pieces, cooking in batches to avoid overcrowding the pot.

Fry the chicken, turning occasionally, until golden brown, crisp, and cooked through. The internal temperature should register 165°F (74°C). This will take about 5-7 minutes for wingettes and 7-10 minutes for drumettes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the cooked chicken to the prepared wire rack to drain.
Ensure the oil returns to 330°F before frying the next batch. Serve immediately.
recipes.notes:
• For best results, cook the wingettes and drumettes in separate batches as they have different cooking times.
  • Once all of the chicken wings have been fried, gently brush the warm Yangnyeom sauce onto each individual piece, coating it completely.

recipes.name: Salsa
recipes.description: A quick and easy salsa, balanced with fresh aromatics and a tangy finish.
preparation: Roughly chop the onion and garlic.
Wash and chop the tomatoes, cilantro and green chilli.
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl.
Check for seasoning and adjust salt, ketchup, or lemon juice if needed.

recipes.name: Bacon Guacamole Bites
recipes.description: Creamy guacamole and cream cheese bites rolled in crispy bacon.
preparation: Cook the 12 slices of bacon until crispy, then set aside to cool. Once cooled, crumble the bacon and spread it on a large plate.
Pit, peel, and mash the 2 avocados in a large bowl.
Soften the cream cheese to room temperature.
Juice the lime.
Mince the garlic clove.
Finely mince the red onion.
Chop the small jalapeno. For less heat, seed the jalapeno before chopping.
Chop the coriander.
instructions: To the bowl with the mashed avocados, add the softened cream cheese, lime juice, minced garlic, minced red onion, chopped jalapeno, cilantro, cumin, and chili powder.
Stir all the ingredients together until mostly smooth (some chunks are OK).
Season the guacamole mixture with Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to your taste.
Place the bowl in the refrigerator to firm up slightly, about 30 minutes.
Using a small cookie scoop, scoop balls of the chilled guacamole mixture and place them on the plate with the crumbled bacon.
Gently roll each guacamole ball in the bacon crumbles to coat them completely.
Repeat this process until all the guacamole mixture is used.
Store the finished bites in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
recipes.notes: Ensure the bacon is cooked very crispy so it crumbles easily and provides a good texture contrast. Chilling the guacamole is a key step to make it firm enough to scoop.

recipes.name: Prawn Pakoda
recipes.description: Crispy, deep-fried pakodas made with prawns, marinated overnight with spring onions and spices, and fried in a light batter.
preparation: Clean and cut the prawns into tiny pieces.
Finely chop the spring onions.
In a mixing bowl, combine the prawns, chopped spring onions, soy sauce, turmeric powder, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Cover the bowl and marinate in the fridge overnight, or for at least 2 hours.
About 40 minutes before you plan to fry, prepare the batter: In a separate bowl, add the self-raising flour and just enough water to form a thick batter. Let it rest for 40 minutes.
instructions: When ready to fry, add the marinated prawn mixture to the rested flour batter. Mix everything together thoroughly.
Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper if needed.
In a heavy-bottomed pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
Using a tablespoon, carefully drop spoonfuls of the batter mixture into the hot oil. Do not overcrowd the pan; fry in batches.
Fry the pakodas, turning occasionally, until they are deep golden brown, crispy, and the prawns inside are cooked through (about 4-5 minutes per batch).
Use a slotted spoon to remove the pakodas from the oil and drain them on a paper towel.
recipes.notes:
• Enjoy these pakodas with green chutney if desired.
  • Substitute the prawns with an equal amount of chicken for a chicken pakoda

recipes.name: Chicken Lollipop
recipes.description: Crispy fried chicken lollipops, marinated in a ginger-garlic paste and then coated in a thick, flavorful batter with minced aromatics and spices.
preparation: Make a smooth paste from the 1 large onion.
In a large bowl, marinate the chicken lollipops with the ginger-garlic paste, onion paste, and salt. Set aside for at least 30 minutes.
While the chicken is marinating, finely mince the 2 medium onions and the green chilies. Finely chop the coriander leaves.
instructions: In a separate large mixing bowl, prepare the batter by combining the minced onions, minced green chilies, and chopped coriander.
Add the ajinomoto (if using), 5 tbsp corn flour, and 3 tbsp maida to the minced ingredients.
Beat the 3 eggs and add them to the flour mixture. Mix well to form a thick, combined batter.
Add the marinated chicken lollipops to this batter and toss until each lollipop is fully coated.
In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Carefully place the battered lollipops into the hot oil, frying in batches to avoid overcrowding.
Fry until golden brown, crispy, and the chicken is cooked through.
Remove with a slotted spoon, drain on a wire rack or paper towels, and eat.

recipes.name: Prawn Toast
recipes.description: Savory fried bread bites topped with a flavorful minced prawn and chicken mixture, coated in breadcrumbs and deep-fried until golden and crispy.
preparation: Clean the prawns and chicken thoroughly.
Mince the prawns, chicken, green chillies, ginger, garlic, coriander leaves, and spring onions together finely.
Beat the eggs in a bowl. Reserve roughly half of one beaten egg for the mince mixture and keep the rest in a shallow bowl for coating.
Trim the crusts off the bread slices and cut each slice into four equal pieces (squares or triangles).
instructions: In a bowl, add the minced meat mixture.
Add the white pepper powder, salt, the reserved half beaten egg, cornflour, ajinomoto, and cashew nut pieces to the mince. Mix very well to combine. Set aside.
Take a piece of the cut bread. Apply some of the remaining beaten egg to one side.
Immediately spread a layer of the prawn and chicken mixture onto the egg-coated side of the bread.
Brush or dab a little more beaten egg on top of the meat mixture.
Dip the top part (the meat side) into the breadcrumbs to coat the filling.
Heat oil in a deep pan or wok.
Deep fry the bread pieces, meat-side down first carefully, until golden brown and the filling is cooked through.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
recipes.notes: Ensure the oil is hot enough so the bread doesn't absorb too much grease, but not so hot that the bread burns before the raw meat mixture cooks.

recipes.name: Potato Chops
recipes.description: Traditional East Indian Potato and Mince Patties. A savory spiced beef filling encased in a soft potato mash, breaded, and fried to golden perfection.
preparation: Boil the potatoes until tender, remove the skins, and mash them until smooth with some salt. Set aside.
Finely chop the onions.
Finely chop the green chillies, garlic, ginger, coriander and mint.
Juice the lime.
Lightly beat the egg in a shallow bowl.
Prepare a plate with breadcrumbs.
instructions: Heat a teaspoon of oil in a casserole or pan and add the chopped onions. Fry the onions until they caramelise lightly.
Add the ginger, garlic, and green chillies and continue to fry the mixture until fragrant, about two to three minutes.
Turn up the heat. Add the mince, salt, and pepper. Fry the meat until browned lightly.
Lower the heat and continue to cook the meat until all the water released has evaporated.
When cooked through, remove from the heat and toss with the herbs and lime juice. Set aside to cool completely.

Take a portion of the cooled mashed potato (about the size of a ping pong ball) and flatten it in your palm (it should be about 1/4 inch thick). If the potato is too sticky, grease your palm with some oil.
Cup your palm a little to form a pocket. Add a tablespoon and a half of the cooled mince mixture to the centre of the flattened potato pocket.
Enclose the filling by drawing up the sides of the potato and cover the filling completely so no minced meat is visible. Shape into a round patty. Repeat with the remaining potato and mince.
Heat a generous amount of oil in a wide frying pan.
Dip each potato chop in the beaten egg, then roll in breadcrumbs to coat.
Fry in the hot oil until each potato chop is golden brown on both sides.
recipes.notes: Ensure the mince filling is cooked until dry; excess moisture can cause the chops to break during frying.

recipes.name: Mexican Rice
recipes.description: A bright and flavorful rice dish.
preparation: Rinse the rice a few times till water is slightly clear and set aside.
Roughly chop the onions and bell peppers.
instructions: In a large dish, roast these along with the green chillies and garlic till fragrant.
Puree the roasted ingredients with the cilantro.
Heat some olive oil and toast the rice till lightly brown.
To the rice, add the puree, chicken stock and salt.
With the dish on medium heat, cover and let cook untoched for 10 minutes or till most of the water is absorbed.
Turn off the flame and leave covered for 20 minutes.
Fluff the rice before serving.

recipes.name: Pork Ribs
recipes.description: Tender pork ribs in a rich pepper based gravy.
preparation: Peel and dice the onions.
Peel and crush garlic cloves.
Grate the ginger.
Slit the green chillies.
instructions: Heat the oil over medium heat in a large, heavy-bottomed pot.
Add the onions with a pinch of salt and fry until golden brown.
Add the garlic and ginger to the pot and fry until there is no raw smell of ginger and garlic.
Stir in the green chillies and add the pork ribs.
Increase heat to medium-high and sear the ribs until they are lightly browned.
Reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot and render the fat, strring occasionally until ribs are semi-tender (~30 to 45 minutes).
Add the bafat powder, black pepper, vinger and soy sauce. Stir to coat the ribs well.
Pour in the rum and continue cooking on low heat.
Once it reduces, add boiling water to cover the ribs and more salt.
Continue cooking till ribs are tender and the water has reduced by half to form a thick gravy.

recipes.name: Mutton Curry
recipes.description: Succulent mutton is a spicy thick gravy.
preparation: Roast the red chillies, pepper, coriander seeds, cumin and poppy seeds.
Slice the onions, green chillies and tomatoes.
instructions: Grind the roasted ingredients with the turmeric.
Heat the oil over medium heat in a large, heavy-bottomed pot.
Add the onions with a pinch of salt and fry until golden brown.
Add the ground ingredients and mix well to coat the onions.
After the raw spice smell is gone, add the green chillies and tomatoes.
Add the mutton and some salt.
Cover and cook till the mutton is tender.
Once the mutton is tender, cook on low till the gravy thickens.
Garnish with chopped coriander.
recipes.notes: While grinding the dry spice mix, add a few garlic cloves and a knob of ginger for a flavorful paste.

recipes.name: Braised Beef Ribs
recipes.description: Galbi Jjim is a flavorful and tender braised beef rib stew. This recipe balances savory notes with the natural sweetness of fruit juices.
recipes.sourceSubtext: A Korean Mom's Kitchen Wisdom and 100 Family Recipes
ingredients: 3 carrots (227g), peeled and sliced 1 inch thick
8 oz (227g) daikon (Korean radish), sliced 1 inch thick
preparation: Remove the membrane from the beef back ribs and separate them.
Peel and chop the fresh ginger.
Finely chop 3 of the green onions.
Peel and slice the carrots into 1-inch thick pieces, trimming the edges if desired.
Slice the daikon into 1-inch thick pieces.
Cut the white and light green parts of the remaining 2 green onions into 3-inch lengths.
instructions: Dissolve the sugar in 3 quarts of cold water in a large stockpot. Add the ribs and refrigerate for 30 minutes.

Transfer the ribs to a bowl and discard the water; clean the pot. Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil in the pot. Add the ribs, half the ginger, and the peppercorns; return to a boil, and blanch for 10 minutes.
Transfer the ribs to a colander and discard the water; clean the pot thoroughly. Under cold running water, rinse each rib thoroughly, removing any coagulated particles.

For the marinade: Whisk all the marinade ingredients together in a large bowl. Measure out and reserve 1 1/2 cups marinade. Add the ribs to the remaining marinade and toss to coat, then arrange the ribs meat side down. Cover and refrigerate the ribs and the reserved marinade for at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours.

Add the reserved marinade, carrots, and radish to an electric pressure cooker. Lock the lid in place and close the pressure-release valve. Select the high pressure-cook function and cook for 1 minute. Turn off the pressure cooker and quick-release the pressure.

Add the ribs, meat side down, and their marinade to the pressure cooker. Add the jujubes, bay leaves, and remaining ginger. Make sure the bay leaves are submerged. Lock the lid in place and close the pressure-release valve. Select the high pressure-cook function and cook for 25 minutes. Carefully remove the lid, allowing the steam to escape away from you. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the carrots and radish to a bowl and set aside.

Turn on the highest sauté or browning function; cover the pot without locking the lid, and cook for 15 minutes, flipping the ribs halfway through. Stir in the carrots and radish and any accumulated juices. Turn off the pressure cooker and add the green onions. Transfer the ribs, vegetables, and sauce to a serving dish. Serve.
recipes.notes: The best ribs for this recipe are 5 to 7 inches long with 1/2 to 1 inch of meat. Back ribs are tasty and more affordable than short ribs. Soaking the meat in water for 30 minutes helps to rid the meat of myoglobin. Skimming the edges of the carrots and Korean radish is a common practice in Korean cooking to create a smooth surface and nicer appearance.

recipes.name: Kimchi Fried Rice
recipes.description: Kimchi Bokkeumbap is a comforting and flavorful fried rice that uses the fat from stir-frying pork to moisten the dish and infuse it with richness. Tangy, umami-rich kimchi creates a boldly flavored dish perfect for a cozy night in.
recipes.sourceSubtext: A Korean Mom's Kitchen Wisdom and 100 Family Recipes
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups (312g) short- or medium-grain white rice
1/4 oz (4g) shredded seasoned roasted seaweed, plus extra for garnish
preparation: Add rice to a bowl, cover with water, swish to release starch, and drain. Repeat 5 or more times until water runs mostly clear.
Cook the rice using your preferred method. Once cooked, fluff the rice, transfer to a large plate or baking sheet in a single layer, and let cool for at least 30 minutes.
Slice the pork belly into rough 1/2-inch pieces.
Chop the green onions and mince the garlic
Thinly slice the kimchi
In a small bowl, lightly beat the eggs with 1/4 teaspoon sugar and the salt.
instructions: Heat the neutral oil in a 14-inch wok or large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the egg and cook, stirring constantly, until soft curds form, about 1 minute. Transfer to a plate and set aside.

In the same now-empty wok, cook the pork belly in three batches over medium-high heat until the fat has rendered and the meat is browning. Transfer the cooked pork to a paper towel-lined plate, reserving about 3 tablespoons of the rendered pork fat.
Wipe the wok clean. Add the 3 tablespoons of reserved pork fat and heat over medium-high heat until shimmering.
Add the kimchi and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the green onions and garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
Stir in the gochugaru, Dasida powder, and the remaining 1 tablespoon of sugar. Cook for 30 seconds, then add the cooked pork belly and stir to combine.
Reduce the heat to medium. Add the cooled rice, breaking up any clumps with a spatula. Toss frequently until the rice is heated through, about 2 minutes.
Add the oyster sauce and toss to combine. Fold in the scrambled egg and shredded seaweed, being careful not to break up the egg curds.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra seaweed and a drizzle of toasted sesame oil, if desired.
recipes.notes: This recipe uses freshly made, slightly moist rice rather than day-old rice.

recipes.name: Korean BBQ Short Ribs
recipes.description: LA Galbi is a classic Korean BBQ dish featuring flanken-style short ribs marinated in a savory and sweet sauce with fruit juices. The thin cut allows for quick cooking and maximum flavor absorption.
recipes.sourceSubtext: A Korean Mom's Kitchen Wisdom and 100 Family Recipes
preparation: Trim the short ribs and cut into 1/4 inch thick slices.
Slice the green onions for garnishing
In a large bowl, dissolve 1 tablespoon of the sugar in 2 quarts of cold water. Add the ribs and refrigerate for 30 minutes to soak.
Transfer the ribs to a colander, discard the water, and rinse each rib thoroughly under cold running water to remove any bone fragments. Let the ribs drain in the colander for 30 minutes.
In a large bowl, prepare the marinade by whisking together the remaining 1 tablespoon of sugar with all other marinade ingredients (from pear juice to black pepper) until the sugar has dissolved.

In a large storage container, layer the drained ribs and pour the marinade over them. Cover and refrigerate for at least 24 hours and up to 2 days, flipping the ribs halfway through the marinating time.
instructions: Working in batches, arrange 3 to 4 ribs in a single layer in a 12-inch nonstick skillet. Add 1 tablespoon of the marinade from the container.
Cook over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes, until the marinade reduces slightly and the edges of the ribs begin to brown.
Flip the ribs and cook for another 5 minutes, until the marinade has reduced by half. Use kitchen shears to cut the ribs between the bones into smaller pieces.
Reduce the heat to medium and continue cooking, turning occasionally, for 3 to 5 minutes, until the marinade has evaporated and the ribs are lightly caramelized.
Transfer the cooked ribs to a platter and tent with foil to keep warm. Wipe the skillet clean.
Repeat the cooking process with the remaining ribs in batches.
After the last batch is cooked, return all the ribs to the skillet briefly to warm through.
Garnish with sliced green onions and serve immediately.
recipes.notes: The best ribs for this are about 8 inches long with significant marbling. For an enhanced serving option, pan-fry sliced yellow onion in some of the marinade and serve the cooked galbi on top.

recipes.name: Crispy Mushroom Galette
recipes.description: A savory galette with a base of melty leeks, umami-rich mushrooms, and a flaky crust.
recipes.sourceSubtext: Recipes and Guidance for Baking with Confidence
ingredients: 1 batch Flaky All-Butter Pie Dough
7 tbsp (100g) extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 tbsp chopped fresh rosemary or thyme
preparation: Discard dark green tops from leeks, then split lengthwise, rinse, and slice thin.
Slice or tear mushrooms into 1-inch pieces.
Smash 3 garlic cloves and finely grate the 4th.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.

In a medium skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium-low. Add the leeks and cook, stirring often, until soft, 10 to 12 minutes. Stir in the mustard, salt, and pepper. Remove from the skillet and set aside.

In the same skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium. Add half the mushrooms, 2 of the smashed garlic cloves, and 1 herb sprig. Season with salt and pepper and cook until browned, 5 to 8 minutes. Transfer to a bowl. Repeat with another 2 tablespoons oil and the remaining mushrooms, garlic, and herb sprig. Reserve the skillet.
On a lightly floured surface, roll the pie dough into a 12-inch round. Transfer it to the prepared baking sheet.
Spread the leek mixture evenly over the dough, leaving a 1 1/2-inch border. Scatter the cooked mushrooms over the leeks.
Fold the crust by folding the sides of the pastry up and over the filling, creating evenly spaced pleats. Press firmly on the pleats to seal.
Brush the pastry crust with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Bake for 40 to 45 minutes, until the pastry is golden brown and the mushrooms are crispy.

While the galette bakes, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in the reserved skillet over medium heat. Add the panko, nutritional yeast, grated garlic, and chopped herbs. Cook, stirring constantly, until golden and fragrant, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
Let the baked galette cool slightly on the pan, then top with the garlicky bread crumbs. Slice and serve warm or at room temperature.
recipes.notes: To ensure the mushrooms brown properly, wait to salt them until they have already developed some color in the pan.

recipes.name: Pork Bafat
recipes.description: A traditional and spicy pork curry made with Bafat powder, whole spices, and a vinegar tang.
preparation: Clean and cut the pork into desired size pieces.
Soak the tamarind in a couple tablespoons of hot water
For the marinade, roughly chop 2 onions and 2 green chilis. Keep 1 head of garlic whole.
For cooking, cut up the remaining 4 big onions and 4 green chilis. Finely chop the remaining pod of garlic and the piece of ginger.
instructions: In a large bowl, marinate the clean pork with salt, 1 tbsp Bafat powder, 1 tbsp vinegar, the 2 chopped onions, 2 green chilis, 1 whole head of garlic, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and cloves.
Set aside to marinate overnight or for a minimum of 2 hours.
Transfer the marinated pork and all the marinade ingredients to a large pot.
Boil the pork for 20 minutes.
Add the 4 cut big onions, the chopped pod of garlic, the ginger, and the 4 additional green chilis to the pot.
Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of Bafat powder. Stir well.
Add the tamarind water, plus more salt and vinegar to taste. Continue to boil and check if the meat is cooked.
If the pork is not yet tender, boil for some more time until cooked through.
Optionally, stir in 1 tbsp soy sauce and/or chilli garlic sauce at the end.
recipes.notes:
• While traditionally eaten with idlis, I love having this with pav or mexican rice
  • Marinating the pork overnight will result in a more flavorful dish.

recipes.name: Roce Chicken
recipes.description: A traditional Mangalorean chicken curry made with a rich, roasted coconut and spice masala, finished with thick and thin coconut milk.
preparation: Clean and cut the chicken to desired size pieces.
In a small bowl, soak the tamarind with a couple tbsps of hot water.
Slice the onions.
In a large bowl, marinate the cleaned chicken with turmeric powder, salt, and vinegar. Set aside for at least 30 minutes.
instructions: In a pan, heat a little oil and fry the red chillies, grated coconut, 2 sliced onions, and garlic until aromatic and lightly browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, dry roast the remaining spices: cinnamon, cloves, fenugreek seeds, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, and peppercorns, until fragrant.
Combine the fried coconut-onion mixture, the roasted dry spices, and the tamarind in a grinder. Add the 2 cups of thin coconut milk and grind to a very smooth paste.
In a large pot, heat the 2 tbsp ghee and 1 tbsp oil over medium heat.
Add the 1 large sliced onion and fry until translucent.
Add the marinated chicken and fry for 5-7 minutes, until it releases water and is lightly seared.
Pour in the ground masala paste. Stir well to combine with the chicken.
Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat, cover, and let it simmer for 20 minutes, or until the chicken is tender and cooked through.
Stir in the 1 cup of thick coconut milk. Add the optional Maggi cube, crumbling it in. Heat gently for another 2-3 minutes, but do not let it come to a rolling boil.
Check for salt and adjust if necessary.
For the tempering: In a small, separate pan, heat the 1 tbsp of ghee.
Add the 1 medium sliced onion and the curry leaves. Fry until the onions are crisp and dark brown.
Pour the hot tempering over the finished chicken curry and serve.
recipes.notes: Be careful not to boil the curry after adding the thick coconut milk, as it can curdle.

recipes.name: Taliwang Grilled Chicken
recipes.description: Ayam Taliwang is a spicy Indonesian grilled chicken marinated and basted in a rich, complex spice blend and coconut milk sauce.
preparation: Soak the dried chili in some warm water.
Butterfly the whole chicken and press it in the middle to flatten.
In a large dish, marinate the chicken on both sides with 1.5 tsp salt, pepper, kaffir lime, and 40g coconut milk, spreading it evenly.
Cover with plastic wrap and marinate for at least 1 hour at room temperature or overnight in the fridge.
Create the blended spice pasteby blending the garlic, 8 shallots, 4 red chili, 15 bird's eye chili, soaked dried chili, 1 sliced tomato, and lemongrass with a bit of oil until smooth.
instructions: Sauté the blended spice paste in a pan until fragrant and the oil seeps out.
Add the 50ml coconut milk, 250ml water, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp sugar. Cook and stir to combine. This is the main sauce.
Set aside a small bowl of this sauce to use as a basting and dipping sauce for grilling.
Heat a grill pan on high heat. Add the marinated chicken and grill until half-cooked.
Dip the half-cooked chicken into the reserved basting sauce, then return it to the grill.
Repeat this dipping and grilling process (so the chicken is dipped twice) until the chicken is fully cooked and charred.
recipes.notes: The recipe involves 'dipping twice' during the grilling process, which builds a flavorful, caramelized crust on the chicken.

recipes.name: Sweet Potato Gnocchi
recipes.description: A minimal ingredient dish that's sure to impress.
preparation: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Poke a few holes in the sweet potatoes and then bake them for around 40 minutes till you can easily poke a fork right to the center.
instructions: Once the sweet potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel and mash them.
Add the garlic powder and any other spices you want to the mashed potatoes.
On a clean work surface, mix the salt and flour. Spread it and create a well.
Add the mashed potatoes to the well.

With floured hands, begin working the sweet potato into the flour. Continue till they are well combined and your dough is dry rather than sticky. Keep adding flour to achieve the just dry dough but not too dry either.
Roll the dough into a ball and cut into 4-8 equally manageable parts.
Roll each section out into a rope about 1 inch thick. Cut each rope into 1/2 inch pieces. The pieces can be grooved using the back of a fork.
In a large pot, bring water to boil and salt generously.
Add the gnocchi to the boiling water and let it cook till they float to the top.
Toss the gnocchi in the butter sage sauce or any other sauce of your choice.
recipes.notes: If not cooking immediately, the gnocchi can be frozen for a couple days.

recipes.name: Sweet Potato Chili
recipes.description: A flavorful chili that's more or less 'pour things into a pot and simmer'.
preparation: Peel and chop the sweet potatoes, onion and garlic.
instructions: Heat the oil in a large pot/pan over medium heat and add the onion once hot.
When the onions have begun to brown, add the garlic followed by the chili and coriander powders.
Stir and cook for the minute.
Add the tomatoes and beans (with their juices), the pepper and dried herbs.
Add 3.5 cups of water and bring to a boil then simmer for around 30-40 minutes.
Add the the sweet potatoes and simmer for around 30 minutes till all the ingredients are cooked tender and have absorbed sufficient flavor.
Add spices as per taste and more water if the chili is too thick.
recipes.notes: Add toppings of your choice like sour cream, coriander/cilantro, etc.

recipes.name: Pork Braised with Chilies
recipes.description: Pork shoulder is braised in a flavorful liquid of beer, chilies, and tomatoes until tender. Perfect for shredding into tacos or serving as an entrée.
recipes.sourceText: Salt Fat Acid Heat - Samin Nosrat
recipes.sourceSubtext: Mastering the Elements of Good Cooking
ingredients: 4 pounds boneless pork shoulder (sometimes called pork butt)
2 cups crushed tomatoes in their juice, fresh or canned
2 tbsp cumin seed (or 1 tbsp ground cumin)
8 dried chilies (such as Guajillo, New Mexico, Anaheim, or ancho)
1 tbsp smoked paprika or 2 smoked peppers (optional)
2 to 3 cups lager or pilsner beer
1/2 cup coarsely chopped cilantro for garnish
preparation: The day before you plan to cook, season the pork generously with salt. Cover and refrigerate.
Preheat the oven to 325°F (165°C).
Remove any roots from the head of garlic, then slice it in half crosswise. (Don't worry about the skins; they get strained out later).
Slice the onions.
Stem, seed, and rinse the dried chilies.
Coarsely chop the cilantro.
instructions: Set a large, ovenproof Dutch oven or similar pot over medium-high heat. When it's warm, add 1 tbsp oil. When the oil shimmers, place the pork in the pot. Brown it evenly on all sides, about 3 to 4 minutes per side.
When the meat is brown, remove it and set it aside. Carefully tip out as much of the fat from the pot as you can, then return it to the stove.
Reduce the heat to medium and add 1 tbsp neutral oil. Add the onions and garlic and cook, stirring from time to time, until the onions are tender and lightly browned, about 15 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and juice, cumin, bay leaves, dried chilies, and smoked paprika or peppers (if using) into the pot and stir.
Nestle pork atop the aromatic base, and add enough beer to come 1.5 inches up the sides of the meat. Make sure the peppers and bay leaves are mostly immersed in the juices so that they do not burn.
Increase the heat and bring to a boil on the stove, then slip the pot, uncovered, into the oven.

After 30 minutes, check to make sure the liquid is just barely simmering. About every 30 minutes, turn the pork over and check the level of the liquid. Add more beer as needed to maintain the liquid at a depth of 1 1/2 inches.
Cook until the meat is tender and falls apart at the touch of a fork, 3 1/2 to 4 hours.
Remove the cooked pork from the oven and carefully remove it from the pan. Discard the bay leaves.
Using a food mill, blender, or food processor, purée the aromatics, and strain them through a sieve. Discard the solids (garlic skins, chili skins, etc.).
Skim the fat from the sauce and then taste, adjusting salt as needed.
Shred the meat and combine it with the sauce to make pork tacos, or slice it and spoon the sauce over the pork to serve it as an entrée.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve with an acidic condiment such as Mexican crema, salsa, or a simple squeeze of lime.
recipes.notes:
• Cover and refrigerate leftovers for up to 5 days.
  • Braised meat freezes exceptionally well; simply submerge in cooking liquid, cover, and freeze for up to 2 months. To serve, return the braise to a boil on the stove with a splash of water.

recipes.name: Carrot & Yogurt Salad
recipes.description: Grated and steamed carrots in a tangy spiced yogurt mixture. My family's take on the Turkish dish - Havuç Tarator
preparation: Grate the carrots.
Finely chop the spring onions, garlic and green chilli.
instructions: Steam the carrots until tender.
In a bowl, mix the yogurt with the chopped ingredients, sugar and salt.
Add the steamed carrots and stir into yogurt mixture till combined.
Sputter the mustard seeds in a small pan with the heated oil.
Add the tadka to the carrot mixture.

recipes.name: Brinjal Salad
recipes.description: Funny story - One day in second grade, we had a discussion about salads in class and we were asked to name our favorite salads. I enthusiastically put my hand up and answered "Brinjal Salad" only to be met by the confused stares of my classmates and teacher. At the time, I thought it was such a unique dish that people hadn't heard of it and they didn't know what they were missing out on. Years later I realized this was not a 'salad' by any means and the dish is similar to a Kurdish dish called Bacanreşk Bi Mast Û Sîr.
preparation: Cut the brinjal into 1 cm thick disks. (Do not peel the brinjal)
Add the brinjal to a bowl of salt water and set aside for 10 minutes.
instructions: Combine the gram flour, chilli powder and salt.
Add a little water at a time to create a thick batter that can coat the brinjal slices.
Drain the brinjal slices and dip in batter.
Heat some oil and deep fry the slices until golden brown. Do not crowd while frying.
Take a small portion of the yogurt and grind it with the green chilli, garlic and ginger
Add this yogurt mixture to the remaining yogurt. Stir to combine.
Chop the coriander and add it to the yogurt mixture.
Layer the brinjal and yogurt mixture and refigerate.
Serve chilled.
recipes.notes: Instead of deep frying, the slices can be pan fried.

recipes.name: Papaya Avocado Salad
recipes.description: A bright and refreshing salad that incorporates fruits and greens.
preparation: Peel and halve the papaya. Scoop out and reserve 2 tbsp of the seeds.
Slice the papaya, avocado and onions.
instructions: Tear lettuce into bite sized pieces.
Blend the papaya seeds along with the sugar, mustard, vinegar, the whites of the green onion, salt and olive oil.
In a large bowl, add the lettuce, papaya, avocado and onions.
Generously coat with dressing and toss.
recipes.notes: Throw in other ripe fruits like pomegranate or strawberries.

recipes.name: Green Chile Pickles
recipes.description: Gochu Jangajji is salty, sweet, and crunchy pickle that transforms green chiles into a delicious banchan. Convenient to have in the refrigerator to enjoy with rice or stews.
recipes.sourceSubtext: A Korean Mom's Kitchen Wisdom and 100 Family Recipes
preparation: Wash the chiles and trim the stems, being careful not to cut too close to the ends.
Pat the chiles dry with paper towels.
Pierce each chile once with a fork to allow the brine to penetrate.
Tightly pack the chiles into a 2-quart glass jar.
instructions: In a large saucepan, combine the water, vinegar, soy sauce, and sugar. Bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the brine cool for about 5 minutes. It should still be hot.
Pour the hot brine over the chiles until they are just covered. You may have extra brine.
Place a small dish or a pickling weight over the top of the chiles to keep them completely submerged.
Let the jar cool to room temperature, about 2 hours.
Cover the jar tightly and place it in a cool, dark location away from direct sunlight for about 1 week, or until the chiles turn olive green.
Transfer the chiles to the refrigerator and let them pickle for at least 3 months before serving. The flavor will continue to develop over time.
recipes.notes: Use young green Korean chiles for this recipe as they have a mild heat and retain their crunch. Don't trim the chile stems too close to the end, or the seeds will be exposed. The pickles are ready to eat when they have turned a brownish green color.

recipes.name: Spicy Green Chile Pickles
recipes.description: Gochu Jangajji Muchim is a punchy and complex banchan that takes pre-made Gochu Jangajji and seasons them with a spicy, sweet, and savory sauce. A simple way to enhance the flavor of the pickles.
recipes.sourceSubtext: A Korean Mom's Kitchen Wisdom and 100 Family Recipes
preparation: Using tongs, lift the Gochu Jangajji from their container, allowing excess brine to drip off. Drain them well and reserve 1/4 cup of the pickle brine.
Toast the sesame seeds and coarsely grind them.
Chop the green onions.
Optional: For easier eating, use kitchen shears to cut the pickles into bite-size pieces.
instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together the reserved 1/4 cup of pickle brine, gochugaru, ground sesame seeds, fish sauce, sugar, toasted sesame oil, garlic, and maesil cheong to create the sauce.
Add the drained pickled chiles and the chopped green onions to the sauce.
Using your gloved hands, gently toss until the pickles and onions are evenly coated with the sauce.
Serve immediately. The dish can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 4 days.
recipes.notes: When removing the pickles from their original container, allow them to drain thoroughly so the final dish isn't watery. The entire pickle, including the stem, is edible.

recipes.name: Braised Baby Potatoes
recipes.description: Algamja Jorim uses potatoes that are boiled, pan-fried and then tossed with a sticky, savory gochujang sauce. The potatoes become extremely chewy and crisp with a satisfying popping texture.
recipes.sourceSubtext: A Korean Mom's Kitchen Wisdom and 100 Family Recipes
preparation: Toast the sesame seeds and thinly slice the green onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together the 1/3 cup water, soy sauce, and corn syrup to create the sauce. Set aside.
In a wok or large skillet, add the potatoes and salt, then cover with water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes until par-cooked.
Drain the potatoes well and pat them completely dry with paper towels.
instructions: Wipe the wok dry. Heat the neutral oil over medium heat until shimmering.
Add the boiled and dried potatoes. Cook, tossing occasionally, for about 8 minutes, until the skins are wrinkled and the potatoes are nearly tender.
Pour the prepared sauce into the wok, toss to coat the potatoes, and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for 1 minute.
Uncover and continue to cook, tossing, for about 6 minutes, until the potatoes are fully tender and the sauce has slightly thickened.
Increase the heat to medium-high and add the sugar. Cook, tossing constantly, for about 4 minutes, until the sauce has reduced to a syrupy glaze.
Remove the wok from the heat. Stir in the toasted sesame seeds, green onion, and gochugaru.
Serve immediately. Leftovers can be refrigerated for up to 4 days.
recipes.notes: Use baby potatoes that are about 3/4 to 1 inch in diameter. If you can only find larger baby potatoes, cut them into 1-inch pieces before boiling.

recipes.name: Herb and Greens Frittata
recipes.description: Kuku Sabzi is a Persian frittata heavily skewed in favor of greens with just enough eggs to bind them together. It features a deeply browned crust and a bright, custardy center.
recipes.sourceText: Salt Fat Acid Heat - Samin Nosrat
recipes.sourceSubtext: Mastering the Elements of Good Cooking
ingredients: 4 cups finely chopped cilantro leaves and tender stems
2 cups finely chopped dill leaves and tender stems
preparation: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) if you do not want to flip the kuku halfway through cooking.
Strip the chard leaves from the stems. Reserve the stems.
Thinly slice the chard stems, discarding any tough bits at the base.
Remove the root and top inch of the leek, then quarter it lengthwise. Cut each quarter into 1/4-inch slices.
Place sliced leeks in a large bowl and wash vigorously to remove dirt. Drain as much water as possible.
Combine the washed leeks and sliced chard stems.
Finely chop the cilantro and dill.
instructions: Gently heat a 10- or 12-inch cast iron or nonstick frying pan over medium heat. Add enough olive oil to coat the bottom. Add the chard leaves and a generous pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until wilted (4 to 5 minutes). Remove from pan, set aside, and allow to cool.

Return the pan to the stove over medium heat. Add 3 tablespoons of butter. When foaming, add the leek and chard stem mixture and a pinch of salt. Cook until tender and translucent (15 to 20 minutes). If needed, add a splash of water and cover to entrap steam. Remove from heat.
Squeeze the cooled chard leaves dry and discard the liquid. Chop the leaves coarsely.
In a large bowl, combine the chopped chard leaves, cilantro, dill, and the cooked leek mixture. Let cool slightly, then mix evenly with your hands. Season generously with salt.
Add the eggs one at a time, mixing until the mixture is just barely bound with egg (you may not need all 9 eggs).
Wipe out and reheat the pan over medium-high heat. Add the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter and 2 tablespoons of olive oil. When foaming, carefully pack the kuku mixture into the pan.
After about 2 minutes, reduce heat to medium. Cook without touching until the bottom is golden brown (about 10 minutes).
To Flip: Gather your courage, flip the kuku onto a plate/pan, add a little more oil to the skillet, slide the kuku back in, and cook for another 10 minutes.
To Bake: Slide the pan into the preheated oven and bake until the center is fully set (10 to 12 minutes).
Blot away excess oil and serve warm, at room temperature, or cold.
recipes.notes: For an authentic Persian touch, add 1 cup lightly toasted walnuts (chopped) or 1/4 cup barberries to the mixture before cooking.

recipes.name: Kufte Kebabs
recipes.description: Essentially a torpedo-shaped meatball found throughout the Near and Middle East. This Persian variation uses ground lamb, saffron, and herbs to create a flavorful, juicy kebab without the complexity of more elaborate dishes.
recipes.sourceText: Salt Fat Acid Heat - Samin Nosrat
recipes.sourceSubtext: Mastering the Elements of Good Cooking
ingredients: 3 garlic cloves, finely grated or pounded with a pinch of salt
6 tbsp very finely chopped parsley, mint, and/or cilantro in any combination
preparation: Prepare the saffron tea by steeping the saffron in a small amount of hot water.
Coarsely grate the yellow onion.
Push the grated onion through a sieve, pressing out as much liquid as possible. Discard the liquid.
Finely grate or pound the garlic cloves.
Finely chop the herbs.
instructions: Place the saffron tea, dried onion pulp, lamb, garlic, turmeric, herbs, and a pinch of black pepper into a large bowl.
Add three generous pinches of salt.
Use your hands to knead the mixture together vigorously. Your body heat helps melt the fat, making the mixture stick together better and yielding less crumbly kebabs.
Cook a tiny piece of the mixture in a skillet to taste for salt and seasonings. Adjust the raw mixture as needed.
Moisten your hands with water. Form oblong, three-sided meatballs (torpedoes) by gently curling your fingers around about 2 tablespoons of the mixture.
Lay the formed kebabs onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
To cook indoors: Set a cast iron skillet over high heat. Add just enough olive oil to coat the bottom. Cook for 6 to 8 minutes, flipping just once on each side.
To cook on a grill: Grill over hot coals until charred on the outside and barely cooked through within, about 6 to 8 minutes. Rotate often once they start to brown.
The kebabs should be firm but give a little when squeezed. If you cut one open, there should be a dime-size diameter of pink surrounded by a ring of brown.
recipes.notes:
Serve immediately with rice, yogurt, or salad.

Variations:

  • Moroccan Kofta: Omit saffron. Replace herbs with 1/4 cup cilantro. Reduce turmeric to 1/2 tsp. Add 1 tsp ground cumin, 3/4 tsp hot pepper flakes, 1/2 tsp finely grated ginger, and a small pinch of ground cinnamon.
  • Turkish Köfte: Use beef if desired. Omit turmeric, saffron, and herbs. Season with 1 tbsp Turkish Marash pepper (or 1 tsp hot pepper flakes), 1/4 cup finely chopped parsley, and 8 finely chopped mint leaves.

recipes.name: Butterscotch Custard
recipes.description: A set custard that is silky smooth, topped with a praline for a crunchy texture contrast.
preparation: Hydrate the gelatine in a small bowl with cold water
instructions: Heat the milk on the stove until it is simmering.
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks, sugar and the custard powder when the milk reaches a simmer.
Temper the egg mixture by slowly adding some of the milk while whisking constantly.
Return the mixture to the stove on low heat or in a double boiler.
Whisk constantly until the mixture thickens and holds the marks of the whisk.
Add the vanilla essence and hydrated gelatin to the custard and mix well.
Pour the mixture into a large shallow dish and let it set in the fridge.
When partially set, sprinkle with the prepared praline powder.
recipes.notes: Substitue custard powder with an equal amount of corn starch.

recipes.name: Chocolate Chip Scones
recipes.description: If you want a chocolate chip cookie for breakfast, look no further. These scones are rich, decadant and pair perfectly with a cup of coffee.
preparation: Mix the chocolate chips with a tablespoon of flour.
Cut the butter into cubes and keep it back in the fridge.
instructions: In a bowl, combine the egg with the milk and cream.
In a large bowl, whish together the flour, sugar and baking powder.
Toss the cold butter in the flour mixture and work the butter in till the mixture resembles the texture of sand.
Add the chocolate chips to the mixture and combine.
Make a well in the middle and add the wet ingredients. Mix until just combined.
Use some bench flour on your work surface and roll out your dough to ~1.5 inch thickness.
Cut into desired shapes and place on baking sheet.
Preheat the oven to 180°C/350°F. Place the baking sheet in the fridge while the oven preheats.
Brush the tops with cream and bake for 35-40 minutes or until golden brown.
recipes.notes:
• Turn this into a savoury scone by using cheddar cheese, instead of chocolate chips, or even bacon. The rendered bacon fat can be used in the dough with the butter.
  • Keep the wet ingredients in the fridge, keeping everything cold help keep the butter from melting.

recipes.name: Stuffed NYC Cookies
recipes.description: Gooey, chocolate-stuffed New York style cookies with roasted hazelnuts for an extra crunch.
ingredients: 12 tsp of filling of choice (e.g., Nutella, Biscoff)
preparation: Spoon out 12 teaspoons of your desired filling onto a parchment-lined tray and freeze until solid.
Cube the butter and return to the fridge.
instructions: Spoon out 12 teaspoons of your desired filling onto a parchment-lined tray and freeze until solid.
In a bowl, combine the flour, cocoa powder, and baking powder.
In a deep bowl, mix the cold butter with the white and brown sugars to form clumps.
Add the chocolate chips and the roasted hazelnuts and mix to form a crumble.
Add the flour mixture and combine at a low speed, then add the eggs one at a time.
Separate the cookie dough into 12 equal parts by weight and wrap each part around a piece of the frozen filling, rolling into a ball.
Freeze the cookie balls for a minimum of 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) with the baking tray inside.
Place the frozen cookie balls on the heated sheet and bake for 16-20 minutes.
recipes.notes: Freezing the filling and the cookie balls is a crucial step to ensure the cookies don't spread too much and the filling stays inside.

recipes.name: Butter Mochi
recipes.description: A chewy and crisp butter mochi cake with a rich coconut flavor. This batter creates a pancake-like consistency for a perfect texture.
ingredients: Cornmeal, coarse semolina, or flour (optional, for dusting)
preparation: Set the oven to 350°F (176°C).
Melt 1 stick of unsalted butter in the microwave in 15-second increments until fully melted.
Liberally butter a muffin tin.
Optionally, lightly dust the buttered muffin tin with cornmeal, coarse semolina, or flour and shake out the excess. This helps the cakes pop out easily and makes the bottoms crispier.
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, add the melted butter, coconut cream, sweetened condensed milk, and vanilla extract. Mix together.
Add the 3 eggs, one at a time, whisking to incorporate each one before adding the next.
Add the baking powder, sugar, and mochiko flour to the bowl.
Slowly pour in the 1 cup of milk while mixing. Continue to mix until the batter is smooth and achieves a pancake batter consistency.
Let the batter rest at room temperature for 15 to 20 minutes. This gives the cake a chewier and crispier texture.
Fill each muffin cup with 1/4 cup of the batter.
Tap the muffin tray gently on the counter to remove any air bubbles.
Bake on the middle rack for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until golden brown.
Check for doneness: a toothpick inserted into the middle of a mochi should come out clean. If your oven runs hot, check at the 30-minute mark.
Let the mochi cakes cool in the tin for 5-10 minutes to allow the crispiness to form, then enjoy.
recipes.notes: You could also bake this in a tray if you want portions with no crispy edges.

recipes.name: Date and Walnut Cake
recipes.description: A classic, moist cake featuring soft, soaked dates and crunchy chopped walnuts, baked into a rich, buttery batter.
preparation: Wash and pit the dates. Place them in a bowl with the 1 tsp baking soda and cover with warm water. Let them soak overnight.
Coarsely chop the walnuts.
Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F) and generously butter a 9-inch baking pan or loaf pan.
instructions: In a bowl, sieve the flour and baking powder together.
In a large bowl, beat the softened butter and sugar with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition until fully incorporated.
Stir in the vanilla essence.
Add the drained, soaked dates and chopped walnuts to the sieved flour mixture and toss to coat them well. This prevents them from sinking to the bottom of the cake.
Gently fold the flour mixture into the creamed butter and egg mixture. Mix until just combined; do not overmix.
Pour the batter into the prepared buttered pan and spread it evenly.
Bake for 45 minutes, or until the cake is golden brown and a skewer inserted into the center comes out clean.

recipes.name: No Bake Cheesecake
recipes.description: An easy cheesecake that serves as a blank canvas for the topping of your choice.
preparation: Hydrate the gelatine in a small bowl with cold water
Crumble the biscuits into your mixing bowl.
Lightly butter the cake pan/dish.
instructions: Pour the melted butter all over the crumbled mixture and the mix it well with your hands till you notice that they begin to stick together and feel somewhat firm.
Press the mixture onto the bottom of the dish as evenly as possible.
Whisk the cream cheese in the bowl lightly before adding the other ingredients.
Add the sweetened condensed milk and vanilla essence and mix them well.
Squeeze in the lemon juice
Warm the hydrated gelatin slightly and add it to the cream cheese mixture.
Pour the filling onto the biscuit base and place it in the fridge for at least 3 hours.
Once set, add your topping of choice while serving.
recipes.notes: Keep the dish closed to prevent the cheesecake for absorbing any bad tastes or odors present in the refrigerator.

recipes.name: Shahi Bread Pudding
recipes.description: This dessert combines the best elements of a silky caramel and a rich bread pudding.
preparation: Evenly spread the caramel from the pack on the base of your dish.
instructions: Combine the milk and custard and bring to boil.
Cut the bread into small pieces and spread evenly over the caramel.
Whip the cream and sugar.
Pour the custard over the bread followed by the cream.
Garnish with kesar and almonds or desired toppings.
Refrigerate overnight or at least 2 hours.

recipes.name: Chocolate Buttermilk Cake
recipes.description: A tender, moist cake with a serious amount of intensity from a combination of melted chocolate and cocoa. This cake is designed to be chocolaty enough to satisfy true chocolate lovers while remaining light.
recipes.sourceSubtext: Recipes and Guidance for Baking with Confidence
ingredients: Butter and flour, for the pans
2 tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt (or 1 tsp table salt)
2/3 cup brewed coffee (or 1 tsp instant coffee dissolved in 2/3 cup water)
Frosting of choice (e.g., Silkiest Chocolate Buttercream or Cream Cheese Frosting, chocolate variation)
preparation: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Arrange oven racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven.
Butter the bottoms and sides of three 8-inch cake pans (or two 9-inch pans). Line the bottoms with parchment paper rounds.
Butter the parchment, then sprinkle the pans generously with flour. Shake and rotate the pans to coat, then tap out the excess.
Coarsely chop the semisweet chocolate.
Brew the coffee (or prepare instant coffee mixture).
Ensure buttermilk, butter, and eggs are at room temperature.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda. Set aside.

In a separate large heatproof bowl, combine the chopped chocolate, coffee, and cocoa powder. Set the bowl over a medium saucepan filled with about 1 inch of simmering water. Whisk until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is completely smooth. Remove from heat and whisk in the buttermilk and vanilla. Set aside.

In a stand mixer with the paddle attachment, combine the butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and oil. Beat on low speed until smooth, then increase to medium-high and beat until very light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
Reduce the mixer speed to medium and add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Scrape down the sides of the bowl.

Reduce speed to low. Add one-third of the flour mixture and mix. Add half of the cooled chocolate mixture, mixing just until incorporated. Repeat with remaining flour in 2 additions and remaining chocolate mixture in 1 addition, alternating (Dry -> Wet -> Dry -> Wet -> Dry).
Use a flexible spatula to scrape down the sides and fold the batter several times to ensure it is evenly mixed and no streaks remain.
Divide the batter among the pans (about 18 oz / 510g per pan). Smooth the tops.

Place the pans in the oven. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, switching racks and rotating pans front to back halfway through. The cakes are done when the tops are firm to the touch and a cake tester comes out clean.
Remove cakes from the oven and let cool completely in the pans. Run a small offset spatula around the sides to release, then invert onto a wire rack and peel off the parchment.
Level the layers, if necessary. Stack and frost with your chosen frosting.
recipes.notes:
• If baking in two 9-inch pans, bake for 40 to 45 minutes.
  • The cake layers can be made ahead: wrap tightly in plastic and refrigerate for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 weeks. Thaw before assembling.

recipes.name: Vorn
recipes.description: A traditional Mangalorean sweet dessert made with green gram (moong dal), jaggery, and coconut milk, thickened with rice flour.
preparation: Scrape and grind the coconuts. Extract the thick juice (first extract) and the thin juice (second extract) separately. Set aside.
Wash the green gram dal thoroughly.
Mix the rice flour (or ground raw rice) with sufficient water to make a smooth batter.
instructions: Boil the washed dal in a little water until soft.
Once soft, add the jaggery, the extracted thin coconut juice, and salt to taste.
Pour the prepared rice flour batter into the mixture (the vorn). Stir continuously to ensure the flour does not become lumpy.
Boil well until the flour is fully cooked and the vorn thickens to the required consistency.
Lastly, add the thick coconut juice and the cardamom powder.
Boil for a few more minutes, then remove from the heat.
recipes.notes: The dal can also be boiled in the thin coconut juice instead of water for a richer flavor.

recipes.name: Praline Powder
recipes.description: The perfect choice for a crunchy sweet topping.
preparation: Give the cashew nuts a rough chop
instructions: In a pan, heat the ghee and add the remaining ingredients.
Lightly toast until golden brown.
Set aside and let it cool completely
Powder coarsely to reach desired texture but not to fine a powder.

recipes.name: Chili Crisp
recipes.description: A fragrant and versatile homemade chili crisp oil, packed with layers of flavor from various spices and aromatics.
preparation: Thinly slice the shallots and garlic.
Toast the seasame seeds.
instructions: In a large heatproof bowl, combine the chilli flakes, gochugaru, Kashmiri chilli powder, garlic powder, and salt. Mix well and set aside.
Pour the neutral oil into a pot or wok. Add the sliced shallots, sliced garlic, cinnamon stick, and star anise.
Heat the oil over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the shallots and garlic become golden and crispy. This can take 10-15 minutes.

Carefully pour the hot infused oil through a sieve into the bowl with the chilli flakes mixture. The oil should be between 115-120°C (240-250°F) to toast the spices without burning them. Stir everything together.
Remove and discard the whole spices.
Once the oil has cooled slightly, add the crispy shallots and garlic back into the oil.
Stir in the vinegar and optional toasted sesame seeds.
Allow the chili crisp to cool completely before transferring to a sealed container.
recipes.notes:
• Store in a sealed container in the fridge for up to 3 months.
  • Add store bought fried onions once the oil is colled for extra crunch.

recipes.name: Yangnyeom Sauce
recipes.description: A classic sweet, spicy, and sticky sauce for Korean Fried Chicken. This sauce perfectly coats crispy chicken, adding a layer of irresistible flavor.
recipes.sourceSubtext: A Korean Mom's Kitchen Wisdom and 100 Family Recipes
preparation: Mince the garlic.
instructions: Whisk all of the sauce ingredients together in a small saucepan.
Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
Cook for about 4 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Remove from the heat.

recipes.name: Rough Puff Pastry
recipes.description: A hybrid of pie dough and traditional puff pastry that uses rapid folds to flatten slices of butter into the dough, creating a characteristic flaky, layered effect. This recipe is a 'rough' version without the fuss of a traditional lamination.
recipes.servings: Makes enough pastry for two 10-inch galettes
recipes.sourceSubtext: Recipes and Guidance for Baking with Confidence
ingredients: 3 sticks (12 oz / 340g) unsalted butter, chilled and divided
3.25 cups (16 oz / 453g) all-purpose flour, plus more for rolling
1.5 tsp (0.3 oz / 9g) Diamond Crystal kosher salt
preparation: Place 1 1/2 sticks (170g) of the butter in the freezer for 10-15 minutes, until very firm but not frozen solid.
In a large bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, sugar, and salt. Place this bowl in the freezer while the butter firms up.
Slice the remaining 1 1/2 sticks (170g) of butter into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Place them on a plate and keep refrigerated.
instructions: Remove the flour mixture and the firm butter from the freezer. Grate the firm butter on the large holes of a box grater directly into the flour mixture. Use a fork to toss the butter bits and coat them in flour.
Add the refrigerated butter slices to the flour mixture and use the fork to quickly distribute them.

Gradually drizzle 1/2 cup (113g) of the ice water into the bowl, tossing constantly with the fork until large, shaggy clumps form. If the dough seems too dry to hold together, add more ice water by the teaspoon, tossing, until it does.
Scrape the mixture onto a large piece of plastic wrap. Knead the dough a couple of times in the wrap to bring it together, then pat it down into a 1/2-inch-thick square, pressing firmly to compact.
Wrap the square tightly in plastic and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Let the dough sit at room temperature for 5 minutes. Unwrap onto a lightly floured surface.
Roll the dough into a long rectangle, about three times as long as it is wide.
Fold the dough in thirds like a letter: lift the bottom third up and over the center, then fold the top third down.
Rotate the dough 90 degrees. Roll it out again into a long rectangle and fold in thirds as before.
Cut the dough in half crosswise. Wrap each half tightly in plastic and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before using.
recipes.notes:
• Do not try to use the pastry immediately after folding, as the gluten needs at least 1 hour to relax in the refrigerator.
  • The wrapped dough will keep for up to 2 days in the refrigerator or up to 2 months in the freezer. Thaw frozen dough overnight in the refrigerator before using.

recipes.name: Flaky All-Butter Pie Dough
recipes.description: An essential flaky, all-butter pie dough. This recipe uses a mix of sliced and smashed butter to create a flaky, layered crust.
recipes.servings: Makes enough for one 9-inch pie crust
recipes.sourceSubtext: Recipes and Guidance for Baking with Confidence
ingredients: 1 stick plus 5 tbsp unsalted butter (6.25 oz / 177g), cold and divided
1 2/3 cups all-purpose flour (7 oz / 200g), plus more for rolling
1/2 cup (4 oz / 113g) ice water, plus more as needed
preparation: Slice 1 stick (4 oz / 113g) of the butter in half and then into 1/8-inch slices. Place these slices on a plate and refrigerate.
Cut the remaining 5 tablespoons (2.25 oz / 71g) of butter into 1/2-inch cubes.
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, sugar, and salt.
Add the 1/2-inch butter cubes to the flour mixture and toss to coat. Quickly smash these butter pieces between your fingertips until they are no larger than a pea.

Add the refrigerated 1/4-inch butter cubes to the flour mixture. Toss to coat, then quickly smash these pieces between your fingertips to break them apart. The final mixture should be coarse and yellowish, with varied sizes of butter bits.
Slowly drizzle 5 tablespoons of the ice water into the flour mixture, tossing constantly with a fork to incorporate.
Continue tossing, adding more ice water 1 teaspoon at a time as needed, until the dough forms shaggy clumps and just holds together when squeezed. Avoid adding too much water.
Knead the dough in the bowl a few times to bring it together, then pat it into a 1-inch-thick square.
Wrap the dough square tightly in plastic, pressing out any air. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours (or up to 3 days).
After the long chill, let the dough sit at room temperature for 5 minutes.
Unwrap the dough onto a lightly floured surface. Use a rolling pin to beat the dough across its surface to make it more pliable.
Roll the dough into a rectangle about 1/4 to 1/3 inch thick and three times as long as it is wide.
Fold the dough in thirds like a letter (bottom third up, top third down).
Wrap the folded dough tightly in plastic and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before rolling it out for your pie.
recipes.notes:
Baking options:

  • To par-bake, line with foil and weights, bake at 425°F for 10 min. Remove weights, prick bottom, and bake 10-15 min more.
  • To fully bake, follow par-bake steps but bake for 20-25 min after removing weights.

recipes.name: Classic Cream Cheese Frosting
recipes.description: A sweet but not saccharine frosting, well balanced by the tang of cream cheese. It beats any plain or vanilla-flavored European buttercream when paired with carrot cake, red velvet, or coconut cake.
recipes.sourceSubtext: Recipes and Guidance for Baking with Confidence
ingredients: Seeds scraped from 1 vanilla bean or 2 tsp vanilla extract
preparation: Ensure the butter and cream cheese are both completely at room temperature to prevent lumps.
Sift the powdered sugar if it is very lumpy.
Scrape the seeds from the vanilla bean (if using).
instructions: In a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat the butter and cream cheese on medium-high speed.
Scrape down the sides of the bowl occasionally and continue beating until the mixture is completely smooth.
Turn off the mixer. Add the salt and all of the powdered sugar.
Cover the bowl of the mixer with a clean kitchen towel to shield yourself from powdered sugar plumes.
Pulse the mixer on low several times to incorporate the sugar.
Remove the towel and beat the frosting on medium-high, scraping down the sides once or twice, until the frosting is light, thick, and very smooth, about 1 minute.
Beat in the vanilla seeds (or extract). The frosting is now ready to use.
recipes.notes:
Make sure ingredients are at room temperature; if the frosting is lumpy, microwave about 1/4 cup of the mixture until liquefied, return it to the bowl, and beat until smooth.

Variations:

  • Chocolate Cream Cheese Frosting: Add 6 oz (170g) melted and cooled unsweetened chocolate to the bowl after adding the vanilla. Beat until smooth.
  • Brown Butter Cream Cheese Frosting: Brown the butter first, let it cool and solidify, then proceed with the recipe.

recipes.name: Silkiest Chocolate Buttercream
recipes.description: A technically challenging but incredibly smooth, stable, and not-too-sweet French-style buttercream. It involves streaming a hot sugar syrup into whipped eggs, followed by butter and melted chocolate.
recipes.sourceSubtext: Recipes and Guidance for Baking with Confidence
preparation: Ensure the eggs and butter are both completely at room temperature to prevent lumps.
Cut the butter into tablespoons.
Melt the chocolate and let it cool completely. It should still be very liquid but not warm to the touch.
In a small saucepan, combine the sugar and water. Swirl to wet the sugar.
instructions: Place the whole eggs and egg yolks in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment.

Turn the mixer on medium-low just to break up the eggs, then add the salt and increase speed to medium. Beat until the mixture is very light, pale, and falls off the whisk in a slowly dissolving ribbon (about 5 minutes). While waiting, pivot to the sugar.

Heat the sugar mixture over medium-high heat, stirring until dissolved. Stop stirring, wash down the sides of the pan with a wet pastry brush, and insert a candy thermometer. Boil until the syrup hits 115°C/238°F (soft-ball stage).
Immediately remove syrup from heat. Turn the mixer to medium-high. Slowly and carefully stream the hot syrup down the side of the bowl into the egg mixture (avoid hitting the whisk).
Increase mixer to high and beat until the egg mixture is very light, dense, and the sides of the bowl are completely cool to the touch (5 to 8 minutes).

With the mixer running, add the room-temperature butter one piece at a time, ensuring each piece incorporates before adding the next. The mixture may look soupy or curdled briefly; keep beating until it comes back together into a smooth cream.
Stop the mixer, scrape down the sides, and pour in the cooled melted chocolate and vanilla extract. Beat on medium speed until no streaks remain. The buttercream is now ready to use.
recipes.notes:
• Ensure the chocolate is completely cooled before adding; if warm, it will melt the butter and ruin the texture.
  • If the buttercream becomes soupy (too warm), refrigerate briefly and re-whip.
  • If it looks curdled (too cold), wrap a warm towel around the bowl while whipping.
  • Storage: Keeps airtight in the fridge for 1 week or freezer for 1 month. Bring to room temperature and re-whip before using.
